1: <sup>1</sup> Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
2: <sup>2</sup> For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
3: <sup>3</sup> I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
4: <sup>4</sup> His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
5: <sup>5</sup> Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
6: <sup>6</sup> Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
7: <sup>7</sup> Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
8: <sup>8</sup> I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
9: <sup>9</sup> Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
10: <sup>10</sup> Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
11: <sup>11</sup> To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
12: <sup>12</sup> He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
13: <sup>13</sup> He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
14: <sup>14</sup> They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
15: <sup>15</sup> But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
16: <sup>16</sup> So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
17: <sup>17</sup> Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
18: <sup>18</sup> For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
19: <sup>19</sup> He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
20: <sup>20</sup> In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
21: <sup>21</sup> Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
22: <sup>22</sup> At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
23: <sup>23</sup> For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
24: <sup>24</sup> And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
25: <sup>25</sup> Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
26: <sup>26</sup> Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
27: <sup>27</sup> Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
